edited by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect additional administrative information and added archived websites. Materials in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Cindy Sheehan Papers
Sheehan, Cindy
Sheehan, Cindy
Sheehan, Cindy
TAM.715
9 Linear Feet in 6 record cartons and 2 flat boxes.
6 electronic discs (cd-rom)
9 videodiscs (dvd)
2 sound discs (cd)
2 websites in 2 archived websites.
2004-2016 The Cindy Sheehan Papers record Cindy Sheehan's involvement in the post September 11, 2011 anti-war peace movement with notes, newspaper clippings and correspondence from Sheehan's anti-war activism. 15 audiovisual recordings of documentaries and contemporary music are included in the correspondence. Born digital materials consist of 6 CD-R recordings of protests and news program features and her website. An activist, author, and former gubernatorial candidate for the state of California, Sheehan's activism centers around anti-war protests due to the death of her eldest son Casey Austin Sheehan in 2004 in combat during the Iraq War.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Cindy Sheehan in 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.088.
http://cindysheehanssoapbox.blogspot.com/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of Archive-it in 2017. The accession number associated with this website is 2017.029. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2020, https://cindysheehanssoapbox.podbean.com/ was added. The accession number associated with this URL is 2021.053.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Cindy Sheehan (b. 1957) is an activist, author, and past gubernatorial candidate for the state of California. Sheehan's activism centers around anti-war protests due to the death of her eldest son, Casey Austin Sheehan (1979 - 2004), in combat during the Iraq War. A national leader for citizens opposing the war in Iraq, Sheehan was also founding member of the Gold Star Families for Peace. Her booksDear President Bush, Peace Mom, Not One More Mother's Child, I Left My Marbles in San Francisco: The Scandal of Federal Electoral Politricks, and The Obama Files: Chronicles of an Award-Winning War Criminal discuss her political views as a part of her antiwar campaigning.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Cindy Sheehan Papers; TAM 715; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Cindy Sheehan Papers; TAM 715; Wayback URL; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. One notebook with mold was cleaned, and re-filed into Box 6.
In 2021, additional archived website was added to the finding aid.
Scope and Contents
The Cindy Sheehan Papers record Cindy Sheehan's involvement in the post September 11, 2011 anti-war peace movement from 2004 to 2016. Personal notes from Sheehan's anti-war activism from 2004-2009 are a part of the collection as well as books from her personal collection from 2003 to 2015. Photographs of her participation in protests and letters of support are a part of Sheehan's correspondence from 2005 to 2013. 15 audiovisual recordings of documentaries and contemporary music are included in the correspondence. Born digital materials consist of 6 CD-R recordings of protests and news program features. Published versions of Sheehan's booksDear President Bush, Peace Mom, Not One More Mother's Child, I Left My Marbles in San Francisco: The Scandal of Federal Electoral Politricks, and The Obama Files: Chronicles of an Award-Winning War Criminal are a part of the papers. It also includes a blog containing clips from news shows, articles, and interviews relating to issues of war, independence, and government, both in the United States and abroad. The blog consists of entries dating from 2009 to the present.
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Cindy Sheehan, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2016 by Cindy Sheehan. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/.
Take Down Policy
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Cindy Sheehan Archived Website : 2009-ongoing
The Soapbox Archived Website: November 2020-July 2021
Appraisal
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored with the permission of the content owner. Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of http://cindysheehanssoapbox.blogspot.com in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Accruals
New site crawls are accrued quarterly.
Scope and Contents
Websites for Cindy Sheehan's blog and online radio show, called the Soapbox. The blog dates back to 2009, but capture of the website began in 2017. Topics touched on by the radio show and blog include anti-war activism, United States miltarism, environmental activism, war tax resistance, critique on President Barack Obama (including publicity for her book the Obama Files), nonviolent intervention, American imperialism, healthcare reform, Women's March on the Pentagon, establishment politics, and local politics in California. The radio show was also occassionally hosted by Irene Sanchez, Matt Sedillo, and Dakotah Lilly. It also includes the Revolutionary Organization of Labor (Ray O'Light) newsletter.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, Sheehan published personal accounts of her experience with the pandemic and misinformation about the coronavirus.
